info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued July 31 at 5:10PM MST until July 31 at 8:00PM MST by NWS LasVegas
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 8 PM MST THIS EVENING FOR SOUTH CENTRAL MOHAVE COUNTY... At 510 PM MST, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area. The most intense rainfall was along Highway 93 near Wikieup. An automated gauge recored nearly six tenths of an inch of rain in 15 minutes. Between 0.5 and 1 inch of rain has fallen. Additional rainfall amounts of 0.5 to 1 inch are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Life-threatening flash flooding. Thunderstorms producing flash flooding. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Life-threatening flash flooding of low-water crossings, creeks, normally dry washes and roads. Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Wikieup, Alamo Lake and Burro Creek Campground. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Travelers on Highway 93 will likely encounter extreme rain intensities.
